books.title: Miss Marjoribanks
books.author: Margaret Oliphant
books.summary: A young woman sets out to revolutionize the moribund social life of a small English town.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
books.author: Frederick Douglass
books.summary: Frederick Douglass describes his youth as a slave in Maryland and his desire to be a free man.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Heidi
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A small girl is left with her grandfather and falls in love with his alpine home.

books.title: Psmith in the City
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A young man abandons his dream of playing cricket at Cambridge because of financial trouble and goes to work for a London bank, where he’s joined by an unflappable friend.

books.title: The Merry Wives of Windsor
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Sir John Falstaff runs astray of the denizens of Windsor by trying to seduce several local wives at once.

books.title: The Magic City
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A young boy, upset by his older sister’s recent marriage, builds an imaginary city out of blocks and household items and then finds himself living inside it.

books.title: Huntingtower
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: A retired grocer seeking a change in his mundane life finds more than he bargained for when he’s asked to aid in the rescue of an imprisoned Russian princess.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: Now It Can Be Told
books.author: Philip Gibbs
books.summary: A British war correspondent recalls his experiences during the Great War.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: A Pluralistic Universe
books.author: William James
books.summary: A philosopher gives an introduction to radical empiricism and how it relates to the experienced world.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Henry van Dyke Jr.
books.summary: A collection of poems by the American author, educator, and clergyman Henry van Dyke Jr., exploring themes of nature, faith, love, and patriotism.

books.title: Democracy
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A wealthy New York widow moves to Washington, DC, hoping to get “to the heart of the great American mystery of democracy and government.”

books.title: Search the Sky
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A man visits several worlds as he attempts to discover why humanity is dying out.

books.title: Call Mr. Fortune
books.author: H. C. Bailey
books.summary: A medically-qualified detective tackles mysteries ranging from a failed assassination to incidents at an all-girls school.

books.title: Tao Te Ching
books.author: Laozi
books.summary: One of the fundamental texts of the Tao philosophy and religion.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
